fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-35201].
  {panel}

A user with Confluence Administrator permission (not member of confluence-administrator group) should be able to go to Confluence Admin > Space Permissions > Recover Permissions and be added as a space admin for that space. (Originally fixed here https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-27896)

!Space_Permissions_-_Confluence.png|thumbnail!

*Steps to reproduce*:
# Log in as sysadmin and create a space
# Restrict this space to yourself only
# Log in as a user with Confluence Admin permission (not a member of the confluence-administrators group)
# Go to General Configuration > Space Permissions > Recover Permissions > Manage Permissions.

*Expected results*:

Space permission is fixed. 

*Actual results*:

Space permission is not recovered. Any page request in the space yields 'Page not Found'. Technically, this is because the recover feature grants the 'Admin' permission only. It should grant the 'View' permission too:

!missing-view.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Recover Space Permissions feature in Confluence is broken

fields.description:
It appears Shortcut URLs are being escaped improperly when certain characters appear either in the Shortcut Link definition or when a user using the shortcut link enters a character that requires encoding.

When you have a Shortcut URL like so:
|| Shortcut Link || Definition || Output || Desired Result ||
| \[term@foo] | {code}https://example.com/nav.do?var1=someVal?var2={code} (note the two ?s in the URL are intentional) | {code}https://example.com/nav.do?var1%3DsomeVal%3Fvar2%3Dterm{code} The entire query string was encoded (wrong). | {code}https://example.com/nav.do?var1=someVal%3Fvar2%3Dterm{code} Where only the '?' and '=' after the first '=' are escaped. |
| \[my=term@foo] | {code}https://example.com/nav.do?var1={code} | {code}https://example.com/nav.do?var1%3Dmy%3Dterm{code} Again the entire query string was encoded (wrong). | {code}https://example.com/nav.do?var1=my%3Dterm{code} Where only the input is escaped, my var1= should not be escaped.

It appears that if anywhere in the query string there appears a character that Confluence thinks it needs to encode, its encoding the _entire_ query string, which is encoding other perfectly valid characters.

I'd like to see this get cleaned up so that it properly encodes the right parts, or better yet, have Confluence not attempt to URL Encode anything in my Shortcut URL definition and trust the author (admin) knows what they're doing. Obviously parameters/term passed into the shortcut link should be encoded for security purposes but what I define in the Shortcut Link URL should remain intact and not encoded.
fields.summary: Shortcut Links URLs are escaped improperly
Need to add "Cache Control: No-store" and "Pragma: no-cache" to the page header of confluence to prevent caching

fields.description:
Steps:
# Input some example texts as h3
# Add a Team calendar macro below a h3 text
# Insert TOC then set TOC level is 5
# Save and observe the TOC

Actual

Expected

In the Team Calendars 5.1.0 we provide a tour feature to introduce to users some new things of Team Calendar. The headers are wrapped inside <h4> tag.

!Screen Shot 2014-10-08 at 10.05.32 AM.png|thumbnail!

This error occurs on EAC at this page 
https://extranet.atlassian.com/display/VN/Vietnam+Travel+Pack
fields.summary: TOC shows invisible texts of Team Calendar

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-35196].
  {panel}

h4. The problem
Our [documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/JIRA+Issues+Macro] states the following "_You can include any columns recognised by your JIRA site, including custom columns_", however when including a JIRA Macro issue in a Confluence page and including the fields {{[work ratio|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA041/Searching+for+Issues#SearchingforIssues-Usingthe%27WorkRatio%27section]}}, or {{progress}} the value of those fields is not displayed.

This affects JIRA Service Desk "Time to resolution" and "Time to first response".

h4. Steps to reproduce:
# In JIRA issue search screen identify the issues that have some value in the fields {{wrok ratio}}. or {{progress}}:
!JIRA_search.png|thumbnail!
# Insert a JIRA Macro issue into a Confluence page using the same JQL and edit the columns to display:
!JIRA_Issue_macro_config.png|thumbnail!
# Save the page and the following will be displayed:
!Confluence_page.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: JIRA issue macro does not display certain columns data(work ratio, progress field, time to resolution and time to first response)

fields.description:
When open a page, click directly on the comment text box to add a comment instead of click on the "Add comment" button on IE8, the browser will throw the Mixed content warning message. 

Chose "Yes" or "No", then cancel the add comment action then do it again, the warning message will disappear but once refresh the page, the warning message will be back again. 

As a possible workaround solution:
*Disable "Mixed Content" Warnings in IE*
Go to Tools -> Internet Options and select the Security tab. Make sure the "Internet" zone is selected and then click the "Custom Level" button. Scroll-down the list of options and set the "Display mixed content" setting from "Prompt" to "Enable."
fields.summary: Inline create comment throws Mixed content warning message on IE8

fields.description:
This request: {noformat} /plugins/recently-updated/changes.action?theme=XXXXXXXX {noformat} results in the response: {noformat} HTTP/1.1 200 OK Server: Apache-Coyote/1.1 Cache-Control: no-cache, must-revalidate Expires: Thu, 01 Jan 1970 00:00:00 GMT X-Confluence-Request-Time: 1412654577325 X-Seraph-LoginReason: OK X-AUSERNAME: admin X-XSS-Protection: 1; mode=block X-Content-Type-Options: nosniff Content-Type: text/html;charset=UTF-8 Date: Tue, 07 Oct 2014 04:02:57 GMT Content-Length: 277
  • XXXXXXXX no supported.
{noformat} Which in turn renders as a web page. This was an attacker can construct a web page and pretend it has come from Confluence. It is not possible to embed HTML tags. Also, bad grammar :) Reported by a customer.
fields.summary: "Recently updated" plugin can be used to reflect arbitrary static content to browser

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-35188].
  {panel}

This is not so much a "new feature" as much as a plea to restore an old feature.

In Confluence 5.1 (and earlier?) you used to be able to limit a search to *Site Spaces* ... i.e. exclude Personal Spaces.    (There was also the option to search only *Personal Spaces*, but this was not nearly as useful.)

Somewhere between Confluence 5.1 and 5.5, *Site Spaces* was removed as an option.

This was a very important feature because pages in Personal Spaces have a bad habit of bubbling to the top of search results, and they are rarely the desired result.   Being able to simply _exclude_ those pages, caused an immediate improvement to the search results.  

In fact, I contend it should have been -- or been settable as -- the default behavior.
fields.summary: Restore the ability to search for Site Spaces (exclude Personal Spaces)

fields.description: Hello, not sure if this is intentional behavior but when a user clicks the tasks section of their profile it seems that the page does not put in pagination for someone that has more tasks than what has been programmed to display.  If we create a custom task report the pagination does occur correctly for that specific user.  This occurred when we upgraded from 5.4 to 5.6.3.  Please advise if there is a solution to this issue or if that is intended behavior.
fields.summary: Issue with Tasks View in Profile

!taskNotificationTab.jpg|thumbnail!

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-35183].
  {panel}

When working in Confluence there used to be the possibility to create tasks without being in edit mode of a page. In order to get this funtionality back here the UserStory/Featurerequest:

I as +ProductOwner working with Confluence+ want the possibility to +add tasks to pages without being in the "edit" mode+ of a page in order to be +quicker while discussing several pages (User Stories)+ with the Team or future Users.

Description:
* Ideally I would write a comment using @user//duedate and select anything indicating, that this is a task, that should be created.
* The tasks should have a connection to the page, where I added the comment/task
* If the task is assigned to a user, it should appear on a users personal task list
* The task should show up in an overview for the page/pagetree/space, that contains the relevant tasks (could in a first step be realised with the "task report plugin").

Tests:
write "@user//duedate: add this task to the page" in a comment to a page and indicate as task
--> the task shows up on top of the page (not necessarily within the page content)
--> the task is shown in the "task tab" of the @user
--> the task is shown in a "task tab" of the space (new tab for spacedetails) with reference to the page

write "add this task to the page" in a comment to a page and indicate as task
--> the task shows up on top of the page (not necessarily within the page content)
--> the task is shown in a "task tab" of the space (new tab for spacedetails) with reference to the page

write "@user//duedate: add this task to the page" in a comment and DO NOT indicate as task
--> comment is not shown on top of page
--> comment is not in personal tasklist of @user
--> comment is not shown in "task tab" of the space
fields.summary: Enable tasks to be created without editing a page

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-35180].
  {panel}

When opening dashboard, the methods below slow down in our customer environment.
* LabelManager.getLabel()
* SpaceManager.getPersonalSpace()

Just after rebooting, it takes 10-20ms to process each methods, but, after a while, it takes around 100ms.

We survey this issue and find that this phenomenon could be due to flushEntity of Hibernate.

* FlushEntity of Hibernate is quickly enough, but sometimes declines in some degree by elapsed time or memory state.(decline around several tens of micro seconds )
* In Confluence, flushMode of Hibernate is configured AUTO and flushEntity is executed when refering.
* FlushEntities calling flushEntity called 11 times when certain user accessed the dashboard.
(i) FlashEntity means the method of SessionImpl. https://bitbucket.org/atlassian/hibernate-2.1.8/src/2366a6e6e48fa7ad8c1c509a9c87fb9811946113/src/net/sf/hibernate/impl/SessionImpl.java?at=master#cl-2492
* Our customer's confluence has a large amount of spaces (The number of Personal space is 4000 and total space is 5000).

They display Favorite spaces on their dashboard.
We confirmed that the value of flushEntity could be changed depending on the order which sort space table by spacename, spacekey and appear at interval of 500, during that process.
The result of the following SQL seems to be the flush.
{code}
select space0_.SPACEID as SPACEID, space0_.SPACENAME as SPACENAME, space0_.SPACEKEY as SPACEKEY, space0_.SPACEDESCID as SPACEDES4_, space0_.HOMEPAGE as HOMEPAGE, space0_.CREATOR as CREATOR, space0_.CREATIONDATE as CREATION7_, space0_.LASTMODIFIER as LASTMODI8_, space0_.LASTMODDATE as LASTMODD9_, space0_.SPACETYPE as SPACETYPE, space0_.SPACESTATUS as SPACEST11_, space0_.SPACEGROUPID as SPACEGR12_ from SPACES space0_ order by space0_.SPACENAME , space0_.SPACEKEY limit 2000, 500;
{code}

In our customer's dashboard, it took 330ms(30ms x 11) to process this flushEntity and Peformance regression seemed to be occurred by slowing due to memory state.

This issue is similar to the following problem of Hibernate.
* https://hibernate.atlassian.net/browse/HHH-2399
* http://stackoverflow.com/questions/10143880/hibernate-queries-much-slower-with-flushmode-auto-until-clear-is-called
fields.summary: Hibernate queries much slower with FlushMode.AUTO
button not displayed

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-35178].
  {panel}

At this moment JIRA does have an APi that allows to trigger a check of all plugins updates that are available and trigger their download and upgrade.
Providing an API for performing this would be of a great importance as it would allow to automate the upgrade of JIRA instances, and even scheduling these updates at times of low load.
At this moment this operation can be done only manually so it cannot be automated.
Also by having an automated upgrade option, this would allow to keep the staging / testing instances with bleeding age versions, allowing to test the effect of the new software versions over instances, preventing problems and downtimes on production instances.
fields.summary: Provide API for automating upgrade of Confluence plugins

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
*NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-35177].
{panel}
All user management features are missing from Confluence 5.6.3 (also 5.6 and 5.6.1) if a Cloud/OnDemand instance with the "user management" dark feature is imported.
h3. Reproduction steps:
 # Export an Cloud/OnDemand instance that has the unified user management dark feature enabled
 # Restore this XML backup to Confluence 5.6.3
 # Log in to the Confluence admin console
 # User link and Group link should both be missing, user management is also missing from the cog.

h3. Expected behavior

User management links should be visible to admins in the Confluence admin console and the cog
h3. Actual behavior

User management links are not visible to admins in the Confluence admin console and the cog
 !ugAdmin.png|thumbnail! !umCog.png|thumbnail!
h3. Related Notes
 * These sections are accessible using the direct url, it is just the links in the left hand menu and the cog that are missing
 * Only affects Confluence 5.6 and above

h3. Workaround
 # The user and group management areas can be accessed directly via url:
 ** Users: <base_url>/admin/users/showallusers.action
 ** Groups: <base_url>/admin/users/browsegroups.action
 # Try to disable the dark feature:
 ## Log into Confluence with an user with administrator permissions.
 ## Go to the URL <base_url>/admin/darkfeatures.action
 ## Click on remove by the entry unified.usermanagement.
 # Or you can use the following SQL to disable the dark feature. The Confluence cache will need to be flushed, and the links will reappear.
{code:sql}
delete from BANDANA where BANDANAKEY = 'confluence.darkfeature';{code}
fields.summary: User and Group Links Missing from Admin Console After Migrating From Cloud to Server

fields.description:
With *Confluence Open Source License*, *Open Source License* type plugins will stop functioning and the license status will return the following error:
{panel}License status: Incompatible with product license (wrong type){panel}
This only happens when you upgrade current UPM to the latest version (2.18)

h3. Steps to reproduce
# Install a plugin with *Open Source License Key*
# Update Universal Plugin Manager to version 2.18
# Go to *Manage add-ons* and choose *User-installed*
# Observe *License Status*

h3. Expected Result
License status: Valid
!UPM_2.17.5.png|thumbnail!

h3. Actual Result
License status: Incompatible with product license (wrong type)
!UPM_2.18.png|thumbnail!

h3. Workaround
*Delete Upgrade UPM via database*
# Shutdown Confluence
# Connect to your database
# {{SELECT PLUGINDATAID, PLUGINKEY FROM PLUGINDATA;}}
(!) Take not of the PLUGINDATAID for PLUGINKEY "com.atlassian.upm.atlassian-universal-plugin-manager-plugin"
# {{DELETE FROM PLUGINDATA WHERE PLUGINDATAID = 'XXXXXX';}}
(!) Replace XXXXXX with the correct PLUGINDATAID from Step 2.
# Restart Confluence
fields.summary: Incompatible with product license (wrong type) error after upgrade to UPM 2.18

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
*NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-35172].
{panel}
When starting up Confluence, messaging like the following appear in the catalina logs:
{code:java}
29-Apr-2020 16:58:21.348 WARNING [main] org.apache.catalina.startup.SetAllPropertiesRule.begin [SetAllPropertiesRule]{Server/Service/Connector} Setting property 'debug' to '0' did not find a matching property.
...
29-Apr-2020 16:58:21.374 WARNING [main] org.apache.tomcat.util.digester.SetPropertiesRule.begin Match [Server/Service/Engine] failed to set property [debug] to [0]
29-Apr-2020 16:58:21.378 WARNING [main] org.apache.tomcat.util.digester.SetPropertiesRule.begin Match [Server/Service/Engine/Host] failed to set property [debug] to [0]
29-Apr-2020 16:58:21.423 WARNING [main] org.apache.tomcat.util.digester.SetPropertiesRule.begin Match [Server/Service/Engine/Host/Context] failed to set property [debug] to [0]
29-Apr-2020 16:58:21.437 WARNING [main] org.apache.tomcat.util.digester.SetPropertiesRule.begin Match [Server/Service/Engine/Host/Context] failed to set property [debug] to [0]
{code}
This is caused by the use of a property named *debug* in various sections of the server.xml file.  For example:
{code:java}
<Server port="8000" shutdown="SHUTDOWN" debug="0">
{code}
While this property may have been valid at some point in time, it is not currently valid according to [Apache Server documentation|https://tomcat.apache.org/tomcat-9.0-doc/config/context.html].

This suggestion is to remove all references to this property in the following files:
 * server.xml
 * synchrony-proxy.xml
 * conf#synchrony-proxy.xml

Additionally, all related online Atlassian documentation that includes examples of these xml files and reference this invalid property should be updated as well.
fields.summary: Reference to "debug" property in Apache Tomcat xml files throws WARNING

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-35168].
  {panel}

It would be incredibly useful if the date format of the Date Lozenge could be customized. Currently, it looks like the only way to display the date is the dd-mm-yyyy format. This causes problems when attempting to sort Date Lozenges that display in either a table or in a Page Properties Report macro. It sorts the day then the month then the year. Thus we end up with:

16 Sept 2014
17 Aug 2014
18 January 2013

I realize most of the world does put dates in the logical order (dd-mm-yyyy), but the US is behind on this unique concept, so I often have people asking me if the date can be changed or if they can put the date in as mm-dd-yyyy instead.

I see two ways of fixing this:

# Allow Confluence admins to specify the date format the Date Lozenge and allow users to enter the date as mm-dd-yyyy.
# Correct the sorting of the Date Lozenge in the dd-mm-yyyy format so it sorts correctly by Year, Month, then Day in tables and the Page Properties Macro.
fields.summary: Date Lozenge Date Format and Sorting

fields.description:
When you move a blogpost that have a link to a page which resides in the same space of that blogpost the link will be lost when the blog is moved to other space. h4. Steps to reproduce. # Start a Confluence 5.6.3. # Download the [Source Editor Plugin|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.atlassian.confluence.plugins.editor.confluence-source-editor] from marketplace. # Upload the add on manually. (i) Source edit plugin will show as not compatible but it will work. # Create two Spaces, Test Pptx and Space 1. # Now in Test pptx space create a blogpost. # Add a title on it and click on link. # Select the Test pptx home as the linked page. # Click on Publish. !img1.PNG|thumbnail! # If you edit the blog and click on the source edit icon, this is how the storage format looks like: {code}

{code} # Now Move the blog post to Space 1 Space. # You will see that the "Test Pptx Home" link will be in red and if you click on it you will be prompt with a creation page screen. !img2.PNG|thumbnail! # If you edit the blog and click on the source edit icon, this is how the storage format looks like: {code}

{code} h4. Notes: This does not happens when we move pages, when a page is created it does not get a space key in the storage format and when we move the page a space key is added (ri:space-key="TP", in above scenario), however with blog post that does not happens which results in this behaviour. h4. Workaround: # Edit the blog post and then click on the source editor icon. # This is how the storage format looks like: {code}

{code} # Now add the space key of Test Pptx Space: {code}

{code} # Hit Save. # The link will be fixed and if you use the source edit plugin one more time you will see that Confluence will also adjust the storage format to the way it should be: {code}

{code}
fields.summary: Link to other pages breaks on Blog Posts when they are moved to a different Space

fields.summary: Only The First 50 Images Are Exported to Word

fields.description:
Frequently, results on Google are presented with a "(1)" before the titles (see [screenshot|^screenshot1.png]) for public Confluence pages. This is not the case with other search engines.

It seems that this is related to the script that notifies "viewing" users that there are new comments/edits on the page that is currently being viewed. The tab/window title indicates "( x )" where x corresponds to the number of edits. This is gone after reloading the page.

It is possible that Google is now indexing JavaScript as well, hence why this is captured in highly edited pages.

To check on Google for examples, search for any of the following keywords: brikit, beecom, praecipio.

To reproduce the new edit/comment nofitication:
# Open a Confluence page in the browser while logged (eg. user1).
# Start another session with a different user (eg. user2) in a different browser.
# user2 edits and saves the page that user1 is viewing.
# user1 will see within a few seconds a "(1)" before the title notifying that there is a new edit.
fields.summary: Google Search is Showing Confluence Page Titles With "(1)"

fields.description:
The link is currently: https://docs.atlassian.com/confluence/docs-56/Userlister+Macro

The documentation is: https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/User+List+Macro

While we're here, it would also be good to improve the description itself. Currently the description is:

bq. Displays a list of Confluence users based on group membership. 

This doesn't convey the power of this macro - the ability to show users that are online.
fields.summary: Documentation link in description of User List macro points to wrong doc

fields.description:
h4. Steps to Reproduce
# Make sure there are more than 10 projects in JIRA.
# Try to create a JIRA Report in Confluence (Create > JIRA Report > Change Log or Status Report)
# Open "Project" dropdown list
# Scroll down and select a project
!changelog.png|width=600!

h4. Actual Results
The selected "Project" is not the Project you have selected from the list.
fields.summary: Unable to select the right project to create a "JIRA Report" in IE

fields.description:
If you label attachments and use the [Attachments Macro|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Displaying+a+List+of+Attachments] to display attachments by label it will not display any attachments.

h4. Steps to Reproduce:
# Setup a Confluence 5.5.3.
# Into a test space add a attachment.
# Give a label to that attachment (test).
# Now create a test page into the new space.
# Add the attachments macro add test at the "Attachments labels" field:
!img.PNG|thumbnail!
# Save.
# Notice that the attachment added in step 2 will not show up.

h4. Resolution

Upgrade to Confluence 5.6.3.
fields.summary: Labeled attachments are not showing up on the attachments macro

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-35154].
  {panel}

Instead of the message:

!message.png!

The error message should include something about making sure to be logged into Confluence or the application, giving a "clue" to the user before checking for permissions.

As an example, the  user simply needs to log into Confluence (and then possibly authorize the link to Jira), but, it isn't displaying such information.

fields.description:
If you use the TOC macro to generate on a heading with a question mark, the link generated doesn't work if you pass it to someone else.

Repro:

1. Make a heading with: How do I do this?
2. Apply a TOC macro on it
3. Copy the link generated by the TOC macro. It produces a URL similar to: http://confluence/xxx/PageTitle#HowdoIdothis?

The link doesn't jump the user to the anchored content.
fields.summary: TOC generated anchor links are not shareable if they contain question mark

fields.description:
h5. Steps to reproduce:
# Attach some PPT and PDF files to a Confluence page
# Embed then into the page using viewfile macro
# Result: All of the files were rendered just fine
# BUT randomly and intermittently, when you revisit the same page again, one of the viewfile macro from all of the viewfile macros will not be rendered - at times only certain page in the PDF is rendered although all of the pages can be rendered just fine previously. The same scenario could happened to the PPT file too. You'll see this kind of error in the logs:
{code}
WARN [http-8534-4] [com.benryan.conversion.PPTSlideServlet] doGet Conversion task timed out for attachment : PK Presentation 2013-11-20.ppt with page number 3, waited : 300, now executing in background.
{code}

Refreshing the page (at times this has to be done twice) helps to render the affected PDF/PPT file once more. Viewing the individual PDF/PPT using viewfile macro in an individual page do not have the same problem. 

h5. Workaround

To force Confluence generate the slide images again:
# Get the attachment ID for the attachment with the problem. To do so, please run the following SQL query in your Confluence database:
{code:sql}select attachmentid from attachments where prevver is null and title = 'filename.ext';{code}
Please replace {{filename.ext}} with the filename with the problem.
# Shutdown Confluence.
# Go to the folder {{<CONFLUENCE_DATA>/viewfile/}}.
# Remove all files containing the attachment id from step #1. Filenames will look like {{slide-1234-1}} where {{1234}} is the attachment id.
# Start Confluence.
# Go to the page containing the attachment embedded in it. This should recreate the images for the slides.
fields.summary: Viewfile macro intermittently failed to render a PDF/PPT file in a page that contains multiple/other viewfile macros
I disabled the Team Calendar Add on, then enabled it again and I can't use it anymore. Please seethe attached file!

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-35137].
  {panel}

When creating a new page, or copying a existing one

+Repro Steps:+
* For a new page:
*# Create a new page.
*# Add some content, including links to pages in the same space.
*# Click on the _Location_ button and change the location of the page to another space.
*# Save the page.
* For an existing page
*# Visualize a page with links to other pages.
*# Click on _Tools_ > _Copy_.
*# Click on the _Location_ button and change the location of the page to another space.
*# Save the page.

In both cases, the links to the pages are broken and they lead you to the creation of a new page with the same title than the one specified for the link.

I would expect Confluence to update the links to pages when changing the location of a page. This is what happens when you click on the _Move_ button.
fields.summary: Modifying location of a page may break links to pages in the content
Import from word break fonts

# Create another page with Page Property Macro Report (e.g. Page 2)
# Set the report macro with the label set on Page 1

*Expected Results:*

*Actual Results:*

Please see attachments.

fields.description:
*How to Replicate Bug*

# Access Confluence "Logging & Profiling" menu
# Click the "Diagnostic" button
# Wait for a while
# Click the "Production" button to set the logging back to default

*Expected Behaviour*

Confluence should bring back the logging configuration back to default as the "User Interface" shown.

*What Happen*

Confluence ultimately shutdown its logging and profiling service causing it unable to write anything into the logs. Confluence log ({{atlassian-confluence.log}} end with this line:

{code}
2014-09-30 20:43:05,248 DEBUG [http-bio-8552-exec-9] [atlassian.confluence.logging.ConfluenceHomeLogAppender] shutdown closing appender
{code}

*The only way to bring Confluence logging back to service is to restart Confluence*
fields.summary: Confluence Logging Shutdown Automatically
Show pages and comments I've liked

fields.description:
The original author of a page gets updates for all of the comments which are posted on that page even after restrictions are applied so that they cannot see the page.

The user should not be able to see the comments unless they can also see the page.
fields.summary: Restricted pages comments visible to original unauthorised author

fields.description:
Images attached to Confluence resized to thumbnail appears to be blurry or lose quality.

h3. Step To Reproduce
# Create a simple page.
# Upload all the attachments: {{attach2.jpg}} {{attach3.jpg}}
# Insert all of the attachments/images and resize the thumbnail. (resize the image smaller or change the px size)
# Save and observe the results.

!attach2.jpg|thumbnail! !attach3.jpg|thumbnail!

h3. Expected Result
Thumbnails should preserve the image quality.

h3. Observed Result
Thumbnail image quality is tampered. 
# Confluence 5.5.6 !conf5.5.6_test.png|thumbnail!
# Confluence 5.6.3 !conf5.6.3_Test.png|thumbnail!

h3. Workaround
Resize the image where it still preserves the quality.

Note: Confluence 4.3 does not have this issue, it renders the thumbnails perfectly. You can resize to any px size (smaller) without losing the image quality.

!conf4.3_test.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Attached images resized to thumbnail appears to be blurry

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-35127].
  {panel}

Please don't resolve as duplicate.
----

This is _again_ a try to get a specific answer from Atlassian for the compromise I proposed in CONF-28275 and CONF-34676.

# We are using Confluence to share content with customers and partners
# We branded each Space with the company logo of each company
# We migrated to Confluence 5 - and all logos are now defaced and therefore violating the corporate [CI|http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Corporate_identity] / [CD|http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Corporate_design] rules of all connected companies
# We don't expect Atlassian to return to the previous behavior - they could there rounded logo approach according to _their_ CI/CD rules
# We appreciate the initiative of John Mason for CONF-35037
# But *we can not wait* until this change is done, assuming that this will take at least 6 month

*Suggestion: restore logo behavior for the Documentation Theme only*
# Don't change the new Confluence 5 default theme because there are limitations in case of the size of logos e.g. in the navigation bar on the left
# But this limitation _does not apply_ to the "Documentation Theme", there is still plenty of space on top of each page, as in Confluence 4
# Therefore, please restore the behavior of Documentation Theme and remove the enforcement of rounded logos for this specific Theme only until CONF-35037 is done

We would take a pass on using the new Theme an we would migrate the entire content to the Documentation Theme.

Probably it's just a simple CSS modification to re-enable the logo behavior for the Documentation Theme ?
fields.summary: Restore Space Logo behaviour for Documentation Theme until CONF-35037 is done
powerpoint file converting failure

fields.description:
Reproduction:

1. Log into Confluence
2. Create new page and place text in place.
3. insert a user-macro and attempt to use inline text
4. save page
5. review page the macro does not display the content inline but under the macro instead.

-Confirmed feature is functional on Confluence 5.6.3
fields.summary: User Macro not using inline text feature.
Enabling User isn't working

fields.description:
Both the [current documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/doc/Searching+Confluence] and the [Confluence 5.5 documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONF55/Searching+Confluence] say that you can "Restrict your search results to a particular space, or to your favourite spaces, site spaces or personal spaces."

This is incorrect.

You _used_ to be able to to this in Confluence 5.1.

But somewhere between 5.1 and 5.5, *Site Spaces* was removed as an option.   

Ditto for *Personal Spaces* ... but it's the ability to _exclude_ Personal Spaces which I really miss (but that's a separate issue).
fields.summary: Documentation incorrectly says you can search for Site Spaces (or Personal Spaces)
Allow User to Select Multiple Attachments to Download or Delete

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-35120].
  {panel}

h3. The problem
When you access Confluence after already accessing some spaces, it'll show the list of recent spaces as in this screenshot (not the title _Recent spaces_):
!Recent_spaces.png!

However, if it's the first time you're accessing Confluence, the menu doesn't show any spaces (as expect), but the title is also removed causing the impression that you don't have access to any space:
!Black_list_of_spaces.png!

This is specially confusion if you have defined a Space as your [Site Home Page|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Configuring+the+Site+Home+Page]

h4. Suggestion
We should keep the tile _Recent spaces_ even if it's the first time an user access the application to avoid confusion.
fields.summary: Improve Space menu on the top header

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-35119].
  {panel}

In the latest version of Confluence, when we search for a user in the quick search field, we will provided with the user full name with its profile picture (if there are any).

Most users that click it think it will direct them to their personal space if the user have it, if the user doesn't have it, it will redirect them to the user profile page.

Regardless, Confluence will direct the user to the user in questioned profile page instead of their personal space.

This behaviour is fine if personal space (home page of the space) is searchable in the quick search which is not and the only way for user to search the personal space is by using the full page search menu.

*Possible Workaround*

# Provide both profile and personal space in quick search, with caption so users can differentiate which link will direct them to profile page and vice versa.
# Combine personal space home page with user profile page as describe on this [request|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-31968]
fields.summary: Personal Space is not searchable using quick search feature
Last User Shared is Still Available in the Share Field

fields.description:
Page with Office Excel Macros exports to PDF removes Excel SmartArt Graphics, Charts, and Tables with Styles.

h3. Step To Reproduce
# Create a simple page
# Upload the Office Excel document {{TEST.xls}} through _Attachment_
# Insert Office Excel document through _Other Macro_ > _Media_ > Office Excel
# Save the page
# Go to _Tools_ > _Export to PDF_
# Observe the PDF file

h3. Expected Result
# PDF file should display exactly the same as the Confluence page
!conf.png|thumbnail!

h3. Observed Result
# PDF file does not display Excel SmartArt Graphics, Charts, and Tables with Styles.
!excel.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Export to PDF removes Excel SmartArt Graphics, Charts, and Tables with Styles

fields.description:
h3.Steps to Reproduce
# Install the User Agent Switcher : https://addons.mozilla.org/en-US/firefox/addon/user-agent-switcher/
# Setup an OAuth link between Confluence and JIRA
# Within JIRA, try to link to a Confluence page (you will be prompted to authenticate to the Confluence server):
!linktoconfluence.png!
# *Before clicking on authenticate*, switch the User Agent to *iPhone 3.0*
# Then click on Authenticate
# You will be redirected to the mobile login page, with URL similar to this:
http://localhost:8544/c544/plugins/servlet/mobile/login?os_destination=http%3A%2F%2Flocalhost%3A8544%2Fc544%2Fplugins%2Fservlet%2Foauth%2Fauthorize%3Foauth_callback%3Dhttp%253A%252F%252Flocalhost%253A8614%252Fjira614%252Fplugins%252Fservlet%252Fapplinks%252Foauth%252Flogin-dance%252Faccess%253FapplicationLinkID%253D939d9195-d55d-341d-ab67-51b3a3722e06%26oauth_token%3DZgFgutNC5nxJiKHp23BmN8VLEsgAECMN
*(Notice the absolute link in the os_destination parameter)*
# Logging in will result in an empty page, with this URL:
http://localhost:8544/c544http://localhost:8544/c544/plugins/servlet/oauth/authorize?oauth_callback=http%3A%2F%2Flocalhost%3A8614%2Fjira614%2Fplugins%2Fservlet%2Fapplinks%2Foauth%2Flogin-dance%2Faccess%3FapplicationLinkID%3D939d9195-d55d-341d-ab67-51b3a3722e06&oauth_token=ZgFgutNC5nxJiKHp23BmN8VLEsgAECMN

h3.Workaround
Remove context path from Confluence. Or Authenticate with a non-mobile browser first, before performing oauth-related operations on the mobile browser
fields.summary: Mobile Oauth Authentication Redirects Wrongly Due to Absolute URL Reference and Context Path

fields.description: In the examples for https://docs.atlassian.com/confluence/REST/latest/#d3e456, we see {{http://example.com/rest/api/content/1234/children/comment}}.

fields.description:

# Install Team Calendar

h6. Observed Behavior
When you click insert the JIRA issue will be missing.

h6. Expected Behavior
Able to view the JIRA issue.

h6. Workaround
# Create a page
# Create an excerpt macro
# Create a JIRA issue inside the excerpt macro
fields.summary: Team Calendar causing Excerpt plugin  not to work with JIRA Macros

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-35093].
  {panel}

Hi,
it would be fine, that the current user is an option in some macros.
At the moment you can select only a user by name and not "current user".

As admin of confluence I have to define new pages and templates e.g. dashboard new. It would be nice, to put some macros into this or personal page to display e.g. my last activities (dynamic tasklist) ...
What we looking for: Please define the current user global to use this in different macros.

Do we have today a solution therefore?

Thank you
Ralf
fields.summary: add current user into macros

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-35092].
  {panel}

As of Confluence 5.5, Confluence is creating a *recovery* folder in the {{<home>}} directory during the upgrade procedure and this folder contains following two files:

# upgradeRecoveryFile-xxxx-xxxx-before.xml
# upgradeRecoveryFile-xxxx-xxxx-after.xml

Unfortunately, these two files are do not function as an XML backup does and it can cause confusion for customers, who think that Confluence is generating an XML Backup before performing the upgrade procedure. It'd be great to rename this folder and mentioned files to avoid confusion.
fields.summary: Rename incident recover file

fields.description:
I got the following email from Ulrich Kuhnhardt <ulrich@comalatech.com>

{quote}
While we were doing some testing with XSS for the shiny new Publishing plugin we found that the velocity renderer does not escape $space.name

To reproduce
Create a space with name '><script>alert('bang')</script>css'
Create a user macro ’simple-space-name' in confluence admin with template ‘$space.name’
make a page in your xss space with content {simple-space-name}

I thought I let you know - shouldn’t be so easy to get an alert on the screen after rendering? 
Happens to rendered .vm from plugins too of course, that’s how we found it in the first place.
The space name is escaped everywhere else and as per https://developer.atlassian.com/display/CONFDEV/Enabling+XSS+Protection+in+Plugins I did expect this to happen with $space.name as well.

Didn’t create an issue or posted to answers in case this smells.
{quote}
fields.summary: Velocity XSS in $space.name
Inserting e-mails into confluence page just copying and pasting
